gw.api.webservice.cc.maintenanceTools

Interface ICCMaintenanceToolsAPI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MaintenanceToolsBase
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CCMaintenanceToolsImpl

    public interface ICCMaintenanceToolsAPI
extends MaintenanceToolsBase
    A remote interface to methods used for managing the application. This is distinct from SystemToolsAPI which is concerned with managing the application platform.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools.MaintenanceToolsBase

      Marks All Aggregate Limits as Invalid and then Rebuilds the AggregateLimitRpts and ClaimAggregateLimitRpts associated for the AggregateLimits These tables are a denormalization of the LimitUsed values for aggregate limits and this method will rebuild them from the transactions associated with the claims against the policy.

      • whenStatsCalculated

        java.util.Calendar whenStatsCalculated()
                                throws SOAPException
        Return the date when the current statistics were calculated.
        Returns:
        date of the when the current statistics were calculated
        Throws:
        SOAPException - if there is exception thrown during the processing

      • markPurgeReady

        java.lang.String markPurgeReady(java.lang.String[] claimNumbers,
                                boolean purgeFromAggregateLimit)
                         throws SOAPException
        Marks the purge ready flag on Claim or ClaimInfo (if the Claim number refers to an archived Claim) for the claim purging batch process
        Parameters:
        claimNumbers - The array of the claim numbers to be marked
        purgeFromAggregateLimit - if true then purge each claim even if it is part of an aggregate limit. If false, the claim will not be purged and an error message will be returned
        Returns:
        The results indicates if the claims were successfully marked
        Throws:
        SOAPException - Upon any error

      • scheduleForArchive

        java.lang.String scheduleForArchive(java.lang.String[] claimNumbers)
                             throws SOAPException
        Schedules the claims for archive
        Parameters:
        claimNumbers - The claim numbers used to look up the claim
        Returns:
        The result indicates the claims processed and skipped
        Throws:
        SOAPException - upon any error

      • restore

        java.lang.String restore(java.lang.String[] claimNumber,
                         java.lang.String comment)
                  throws SOAPException
        Retrieve the claim
        Parameters:
        claimNumber - The claim numbers used to look up the claim
        comment - The reason for restore
        Returns:
        The result indicates the claims processed and skipped
        Throws:
        SOAPException - upon any error

      • scheduleAggLimitRebuildOfClaims

        java.lang.String scheduleAggLimitRebuildOfClaims(java.lang.String[] claimNumbers)
                                          throws SOAPException
        Rebuilds the AggregateLimitRpts and ClaimAggregateLimitRpts associated for the AggregateLimits which are defined for the same policy period as the claims passed in.

        These tables are a denormalization of the LimitUsed values for aggregate limits and this method will rebuild them from the transactions associated with the claims. A separate batch job is available which can rebuild all the aggregate limits in the system.

        Throws SOAPException if a problem occurs while creating the aggregate limits.

        Parameters:
        claimNumbers - Claim numbers of the claims for which the aggregate limits need to be rebuilt
        Returns:
        result status message
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • scheduleAggLimitRebuildOfPolicies

        java.lang.String scheduleAggLimitRebuildOfPolicies(java.lang.String[] policyNumbers)
                                            throws SOAPException
        Rebuilds the AggregateLimitRpts and ClaimAggregateLimitRpts associated for the AggregateLimits which are defined for the same policy period as the policies passed in.

        These tables are a denormalization of the LimitUsed values for aggregate limits and this method will rebuild them from the transactions associated with the claims against the policy. A separate batch job is available which can rebuild all the aggregate limits in the system.

        Throws SOAPException if a problem occurs while creating the aggregate limits.

        Parameters:
        policyNumbers - Policy numbers of the policies for which the aggregate limits need to be rebuilt
        Returns:
        result status message
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • scheduleAggLimitRebuildAllLimits

        java.lang.String scheduleAggLimitRebuildAllLimits()
                                           throws SOAPException
        Marks All Aggregate Limits as Invalid and then Rebuilds the AggregateLimitRpts and ClaimAggregateLimitRpts associated for the AggregateLimits

        These tables are a denormalization of the LimitUsed values for aggregate limits and this method will rebuild them from the transactions associated with the claims against the policy.

        Throws SOAPException if a problem occurs while marking the aggregate limits as invalid. A work queue process actually rebuilds the limits that are marked as invalid.

        Returns:
        result status message
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • scheduleAggLimitRebuildInvalidLimits

        java.lang.String scheduleAggLimitRebuildInvalidLimits()
                                               throws SOAPException
        Rebuild all AggregateLimitRpts and ClaimAggregateLimitRpts which are associated with the AggregateLimits which are marked as invalid.

        These tables are a denormalization of the LimitUsed values for aggregate limits and this method will rebuild them from the transactions associated with the claims against the policy.

        Throws SOAPException if a problem occurs while creating the work items. A work queue process actually rebuilds the limits that are marked as invalid.

        Returns:
        result status message
        Throws:
        SOAPException
